messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 5619
messages.messageBody:
<<Message: 6
Date: Tue, 20 Dec 2005 14:41:13 -0000
From: "momspeapods" <jagreensboro@...>
Subject: Sibling Fighting

<<Hi,

Does anyone have any advice on sibling fighting? It's usually the same
story my older son picks on the younger one until he gets mad and
pounces on his brother. It doesn't seem that anything we try is
working. Today the older one woke up with a black eye and scratches
all over his face which was the result of Starwars play gone bad.

Thanks for the Help.

Jenn>>
*************************************************************************
Maybe try to help the younger one through his feelings.
I have 4 and they do get on each others nerves at times. Usually it's bc I
missed a child who needed to snuggle or snack.

I too have older and younger who play games together and there have been
battles. They refuse to not play together so it's something that needs time to
grow and we work it out.

I would be just as concerned about the older child's space though...
Laura


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
